title: Luciano Borgognoni
text: Luciano Borgognoni (12 October 1951 – 2 August 2014) was an Italian <a href="cycle%20sport">cyclist</a>. As an amateur he won the 4000 m team pursuit event at the 1971 World Championships and placed fifth and ninth in the <a href="Cycling%20at%20the%201972%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20individual%20pursuit">individual</a> and <a href="Cycling%20at%20the%201972%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20team%20pursuit">team pursuit</a> at the <a href="1972%20Summer%20Olympics">1972 Summer Olympics</a>, respectively. After the Olympics he became professional road racer and won the <a href="Giro%20del%20Friuli">Giro del Friuli</a> and one stage in the <a href="Giro%20di%20Sardegna">Giro di Sardegna</a> in 1974. He rode the <a href="Giro%20d%E2%80%99Italia">Giro d’Italia</a> in 1973–82 and won two stages in 1977. He failed to complete the <a href="1976%20Tour%20de%20France">1976 Tour de France</a>.
